website_summaries.verdict: The HP Photosmart C5180 is a perfectly acceptable photo all-in-one, but you can get more features and faster print speeds for the same amount of money.
pros: Decent overall print quality and speed
lots of options for photo printing
support both Windows and Mac PCs
cons: fewer task options than printers in the same price range

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been and still is reliable, makes very good quality photo's and continues to work faithfully after 5 yrs. I feel no need to replace it anytime soon. Even if it is a little outdated (no Bluetooth). The only thing wrong is the memory card reader, but I never even tried to use that until a year or so ago and it didn't work then, so... It's easy to use and I have never had it serviced by anyone, and this printer has been used heavily so it is a high quality, hearty little thing. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hubble

customer_reviews.title: Printer arrived on time, but displayed Ink Jet Fault ...
customer_reviews.text: Printer arrived on time, but displayed Ink Jet Fault upon startup. Took it to authorized HP device center, and was informed the entire printer head needed replacement. You would think that someone would have tested a previously used item before sending it out. Major inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad...
customer_reviews.text: Only two things I could really ding HP for on this one. 1.) The Photo printer prints better directly from the Cameras' memory cards than from the computer files sent as a print command via various photo software or applications (even HP's own)... 2.) Don't fall for the HP Photo Value Pack (Photo paper & six ink cartridges) the ink cartridges are half full (which allows them to sell it at that price...) I also hear a lot of people whining about buying this product expecting it to have fax capabilities, also. (Please Note. It says "Printer, Scanner, Copier.") It's a PSC. Not what some, now, consider a true "All-in-One."
customer_reviews.author: Strnj1

customer_reviews.title: great replacement printer!
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our C5180 All-in-One Printer with this one, the same type machine. This printer uses 6 ink cartridges & when ours died we had over $100 in ink. This is a great machine, very easy to use & great quality of printing.
customer_reviews.author: hapydee

customer_reviews.title: Software not great
customer_reviews.text: I like the printer, it was sent by slow mail but was here in only three days. I am happy with it, I like that the buttons are on front so I can have it on a shelf and not have to get over the top of it to see what I am doing. The software is not so good. I would like to reinstall my software from my old HP printer, I could almost use it with my eyes closed. I may try to dump this new stuff and reinstall the old. Amazon is great to o business with, they have everything! Rita
customer_reviews.author: Mossy

customer_reviews.title: Packing was perfect, no damage
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived in a short amount of time. Packing was perfect, no damage. The printer is just like the one I had. I am very pleased with this printer. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Jamsc

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite printer of all time
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite printer of all time. It is very conservative on ink and does fantastic photographs. The XL cartridges are very reasonable in price and last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Will never buy HP again
customer_reviews.text: I have two computers, a Toshiba laptop and a high quality custom tower computer with Windows XP.. This all-in-one software never was able to scan to my desktop computer. After MONTHS of dealing with HP customer (non)service, I have given up and will never buy HP again. I even bought a new software CD on their suggestion - no results. Also, even though it is barely getting used, the ink cartridges need replacing quite often. I suggest you look elsewhere for a good all-in-one. Mine is flying off the balcony quite soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Best of many
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several brand printers and found several to work very well, but I am very pleased with the quality of this one. I put a print in water overnight and it did not effect the picture at all. I tried it before with other brads and the ink washed off. Ink is a little exspensive, but if you buy the HP value pack it cuts your cost down. I intent to use only HP ink in this printer as I have a stack of printers that are clogged by useing generic ink.
customer_reviews.author: Donald J. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for me...Looks nice, prints nice and it's fast. The ink doesn't cost me much because I buy it from a non-hp distributor. Doesn't use ink as fast as some say, I just printed 60 pages of black and color, my ink barely budged if at all.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Hp Photosmart C5180 All-In-One Printer
customer_reviews.text: I recieved this printer as a gift from my son. It has 6 ink cartridges, so the photos are very crisp and clear. I am amazed at the speed and clarity of the pictures I print. The ink is instant dry..so you don't have to worry about smudging when you remove them from the printer like my old printer. I would definitely recommend this printer to anyone who is looking to print there own photos.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Dingedahl

customer_reviews.title: It arrived on time but all the ink is expired ...
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time but all the ink is expired, so I have had to buy more ink which is in-date. This is my second one, the first died when the ink cartridges exploded and it could not be fixed. May never buy another one as the $700.00 price tag is too steep for mr know.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon T. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Been good for us
customer_reviews.text: Has held up well. Makes nice prints and scans well. Only issue has been difficulty pulling in some types of photo paper.
customer_reviews.author: Tony B.

customer_reviews.title: I really don't know what happen all the ink damage ...
customer_reviews.text: I really don't know what happen all the ink damage my bedspread when i was about to install it, i had to throw it away the same day it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Elsa M. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: c5180 printer review
customer_reviews.text: Printer works fine. Easy to install across a home network. However, the software that drives the printer seems to be full of bugs. The printer driver causes the computer to continuously check the network connection, using up computer resources; and the printer driver causes windows xp shut down routine to hang up, with an error given as "windows is trying to close xxxhp program, program not responding". These bugs are just irritating and do not seem to effect the performance of the printer. Hp should have done a better job with the software.
customer_reviews.author: S. Balke

customer_reviews.title: I have owned this printer in the past and loved it.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this printer came to me as inoperable. Very disappointed as I had to buy several brand new cartridges for a printer that was broken. The dealer did refund my purchase but I am still out the money for the new cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: dallasbubbys

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Software and Support
customer_reviews.text: After using the Printer, which is a nice unit, I had numerous Software related functions that did not work on the Printer. I called HP for some help but found their Tech Support to one of the worst. I spoke with two (2) different techs who could not solve the problem and told me to contact Microsoft. I spoke to Dell and Microsoft who both spent time trying to solve the problem and both agreed that the problem was strictly an HP problem. I never solved the problem and returned the Printer to Amazon for credit. I am now using a Dell printer with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Barry J. Kronsberg

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: Had it a few weeks now and have printed probrably around 100 photos. Could not have chosen a better printer for the money. The only thing that bothered me was that hp does not include a usb cable. Whats up with that.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mccormack

customer_reviews.title: C5180 Photosmart printer
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome printer. It delivers! Clear, precise picture printing. Scans and copies nicely. Overall ease of use, what I'd call, "user friendly". I'd highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Vie

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart C5180
customer_reviews.text: Fast service, easy to set up and use, and prints photos and letters quickly and neatly. I only gave it 4 stars because I went to print out an envelope as per my old HP printer but it did not print the envelope. I'll have to research that issue. Love the fact that I can now scan a page in a book or magazine and I have - perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Bowman

customer_reviews.title: not very good
customer_reviews.text: Was looking forward to getting this all in one printer but very dissappointed so far. Very, very slow reaction time for printing or copying. Takes way to long to start the printing or copying process even after it has been on and warmed up for a while.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wesneski

customer_reviews.title: C5180 All-In-One Printer
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, the installation process for this printer is time consuming and cumbersome. Other than that, I love what I have seen so far from this printer. The scanning and coping functions have worked very well with above average quality. Print quality is very good. While it takes about 30 seconds to send a document over the wireless network, it certainly is nice not to have to plug my laptop into the printer every time I want to print something. A great choice for a printer in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Ron G.

customer_reviews.title: Slow to warm up
customer_reviews.text: The printer does an excellent job in printing both pictures and documents. My only complaints are that it seems to take a long time to complete its warm-up process. Also, it is noiser than my prior HP 932c. But, overall I am very pleased with its performance so far.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hess

customer_reviews.title: as expected for HP
customer_reviews.text: Nice photo printer, but I'm not excited about the all-in-one. I'd consider the all-in-one features to be entry level. Nice printer overall. Not intended for heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, but a little noisy
customer_reviews.text: Speed and quality on scanning, printing, and copying is great, but it is a bit noisy when scanning. Printed a 4x6 from a 5x7, and it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazon Tech Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Why-
customer_reviews.text: for some reason my computer would not accept it even though I have one just like it hooked up to that computer. I ordered it after the old one started acting up and I still had ALOT of ink left.
customer_reviews.author: sandra lynn allen

customer_reviews.title: Love it .
customer_reviews.text: I had one like it and it started leaking, I ordered this one to replace it and so far it has worked quite well . I loved the one I had like this one and a hoping I will like this one as much . I don't know why they quit making this all in one printer , scanner, copier. It is all you need in one machine.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby James

customer_reviews.title: Satified Customer!
customer_reviews.text: I have tested this printer and so far i have no complaints, though it may be a second hand printer its in great working condition.
customer_reviews.author: Truth777

customer_reviews.title: HP 5180 Printer
customer_reviews.text: I shopped for a HP Printer that uses individual ink cartridges for each color. After looking at all printers available the HP-5180 met my needs the best. I am very pleased with the printer and the quick shipping.
customer_reviews.author: S. Evelyn Nordahl

customer_reviews.title: Good for home printing
customer_reviews.text: This all in one printer is fairly easy to use. It is a little noisy when it's calibrating and starting up, but the noise doesn't bother me much because I got a pretty good deal for it. I use it for occasional printing of documents, photos, and some scanning. Like I said before, it is great for home use. I probably wouldn't recommend it for home offices or businesses.
customer_reviews.author: C. Chen

customer_reviews.title: printer
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the print is good, but the printer is loud and does shake a lot in the process.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Prints nicely
customer_reviews.text: I use this printer at work, and had to get one for the house. Prints great pictures, and fast.
customer_reviews.author: C. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: C5180 printer wonder
customer_reviews.text: We have four computers all now us the same printer. The pictures are getting better as we us it more. Colors great last printer colors were off.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Strebe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all-in-one printer, scanner, copier
customer_reviews.text: The Photosmart C5180 has every feature that I would ever need in an all-in-one device. For the price, it's an excellent buy. If there was anything that I didn't like (and this is a nit), it frequently goes into a processing mode (not sure what it's doing or cleaning or calibrating). However, it doesn't take that long. In summary, easy to use (in all modes), good quality, and good price.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Morgenstern

customer_reviews.title: HP - good printer
customer_reviews.text: Printer arrived in good shape and was easy to get installed. Have used it for 4x6 photos only so far and the images appear to be nice quality. Print speeds are not as fast as advertised for B&W. We are happy with the printerer and feel we paid a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Hunter

customer_reviews.title: HP Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer though no longer produced by H/P is great. The newer models are not as good by far.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hyde

customer_reviews.title: a  must have printer for home
customer_reviews.text: can network without special adapters , ease of use , a real no brainer
customer_reviews.author: Walter L

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: THE PRINTER HAD NO TRAY FOR 4X6 PHOTOS, MINE HAS A TRAY THAT PULLS OUT
customer_reviews.author: maryellen0311

product_meta.title: HP Photosmart C5180 All-in-One Printer, Scanner, Copier (#Q8220A)
product_meta.description:
HP C5180 Photosmart All in One Printer/HP Photosmart C5180 All-in-One Printer, Scanner, Copier Overview Print, scan and copy with true-to-life color using the high-performance HP Photosmart C5180 All-in-One Printer, Scanner, Copier. Based on HP's scalable printing technology, this stylish all-in-one is the world's fastest photo printer with 4x6-inch photo speed as fast as 12 seconds. The HP Photosmart C5180 All-in-One allows users to print laser-quality documents and lab-quality photos without a computer using USB flash memory drive and the large 2.4-inch color image display. Key features and benefits. Efficiently designed individual ink cartridges allow users to replace only the ink colors used ideal for high-volume printing.

AMAZON.COM
Amazon.com Product Description The HP Photosmart C5180 All-in-One Printer, Scanner, and Copier can help increase the productivity of your business. This stylish multi-function unit works incredibly fast and prints, scans and copies with true-to-life color that gives your documents an edge. 



Intuitive controls make printing tasks a snap. View larger. Extremely versatile and convenient, the C5180 gives you the option of printing laser-quality documents and lab-quality photos without a computer using memory cards, USB flash memory drive, and a large, easy-to-read 2.4-inch color image display. It's a worthwhile investment for any growing business or individual who wants the option to print photos at home. 



The C5180 can handle most memory card formats, as well as PictBridge-capable devices. Fast Speeds and High-Quality Results
The stylish C5180 combines fast speeds with high-quality results. For instance, it prints a 4 x 6-inch photo in as fast as 12 seconds from the automated 4 x 6-inch tray, while six-ink printing with HP Vivera Inks produces rich and realistic photos that resist fading for generations. The C5180 also offers print speeds of up to 32 pages per minute (ppm) in black and white and up to 31 ppm in color. The efficiently designed individual ink cartridges allow you to replace only the ink colors used-- a money-saving function that's ideal for high-volume workgroups. In addition, the HP Photosmart Express button makes completing the digital photography experience fast and easy by letting you view, print, share and save in seconds. At the same time, HP Photosmart Premier software makes it easy to edit, organize, print, share, archive and create photo projects, giving you all kinds of creative options to enhance your business.

 High Resolution For Vivid Documents and Photos
Designed to give you numerous options, the C5180 lets you make color and black and white copies, or print landscapes and other panoramic images in any size up to 8.5 x 24 inches, with or without borders. Troubleshoot any problems by using the 2.4-inch QVGA color image display that adjusts for optimal viewing from any angle so you can select, rotate, crop, zoom and remove red-eye directly from the display without using a computer. When it's time to print, enjoy vivid, eye-catching images, photos, and copies thanks to high resolutions of 4,800 optimized dots per inch (dpi) for photos, 2,400 x 2,400 dpi optical resolution for scans, and up to 4,800 x 1,200 dpi for color copying.

 Easy and Versatile Operation
With the C5180, you won't have to worry about struggling to complete your jobs. This system features an intuitive control panel and convenient one-touch buttons that are easy to use. For additional flexibility, you can take advantage of memory card slots compatible with CompactFlash, MultiMedia Card, Secure Digital, Media Stick, Memory Stick Duo and XD-Picture Cards.

 What's in the box
HP Photosmart C5180 Printer, HP 02 Black Ink Cartridge (16 ml), HP 02 Cyan Ink Cartridge (4.5 ml), HP 02 Magenta Ink Cartridge (4.5 ml), HP 02 Yellow Ink Cartridge (4.5 ml), HP 02 Light Cyan Ink Cartridge (4.5 ml), HP 02 Light Magenta Ink Cartridge (4.5 ml), HP Photosmart Premier software on CD-ROM, setup guide, basics guide, power supply, power cord
feature_bullets: 2400 x 4800 DPI Optical Resolution Scanning/4800-DPI Enhanced Resolution/48-bit Color 256 Grayscale Levels
Print Speeds of up to 32 Pages-Per-Minute (ppm) Black and up to 31 ppm Color/Six Ink Printing with HP Vivera Inks
Print Lab-Quality Photos in as Fast as 12 Seconds without a Computer/Effortlessly Print Landscapes or Other Panoramic
Color and Black and White Copies, and Photo Reprints without a Computer/HP Real Life Technologies Let Users Automatically Enhance and Edit Photos

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars175 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
